title: Fonts by decade
content: I'm creating some period artwork and I want to make sure my type is period accurate. Does anyone have a good resource for determining what year certain fonts were created?
author: kiarostami

comments.content:
FontBook  
Published by FontShop International, and due for a new version soon.  
That will give you digital era.

American Metal Typefaces of the Twentieth Century  
Published by Oak Knoll

Printing Types  
By Daniel Berkeley Updike  
That will take you right back
[MyFonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415123201/http:/www.myfonts.com/?refby=typographica) has a design date data for many fonts. Just do a search.

I've been wanting [such a database](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415123201/http:/typophile.com/node/16536) for a while. Unfortunately, I've had to resort to researching the individual faces, which can be tedious, however useful and enriching.

[http://www.identifont.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20120415123201/http:/www.identifont.com/ "http://www.identifont.com") is a fast way to find such.

Héctor
